Activity: Log in to the system, check emails, and review the movement code implemented yesterday.
Implement basic jumping functionality using the spacebar. Ensure the character can only jump when grounded.
Implement a simple gravity system to pull the character back down after jumping. Fine-tune the gravity and jump height values to achieve a natural feel.
Introduce basic collision detection to prevent the character from walking through walls or other solid objects. Use raycasting or collider components to detect collisions.
Implement a basic animation system to play walking, running, and jumping animations. Find free animation assets online or create simple placeholder animations.
Experiment with different camera perspectives and camera movement styles. Try implementing a third-person over-the-shoulder camera or a more dynamic camera that adjusts based on the environment.
Research the implementation of acceleration and deceleration on character movement to simulate the inertia of an object with mass. Start implementing this feature.
Commit the changes to the version control system (Git). Write a descriptive commit message explaining the changes made.
